original: Levin, Nils Karl, s-anatorieläkare, Saleboda, f. 10/9/01 i Sthlm av dir. Hugo L. o. Anna Jacobsson. G. 34 m. Alice (Lisa) Münnich. Barnr Klas f. 35, Ann 36. — Studrex. i Sthlm^ 20, med. dr 36, allt v. Karol. inst. Assist r-läk. v. barnsjukh. Samariten 27-28, undrläk. v. Värml. läns sanat. 28-30, tf. as!sist. v. hälsovrndns i Sthlm bakteriolog. lab. 30, e. o. und rläk. v. Se-rafrlas. med. poliklin. 30-31, undrläk. v. Söderby sjukh. 31-34, v. S rt Eriks sjukh. med. avd. 34-38, tf. sanat rläk. v. Blek. läns sanat. i Fur 39, sanat r-läk. där sed. 44. Utr. stud rresor 23, 29, 31, 32 o. 36. Skr. r ett 20-tal avh. 0. upps. i inv. med. o. tub runders.
translated: Levin, Nils Karl, district physician, Saleboda, born on October 9th, 1901 in Stockholm, son of director Hugo L. and Anna Jacobsson. Married in 1934 to Alice (Lisa) Münnich. Children: Klas, born in 1935, Ann, born in 1936. Completed secondary education in Stockholm in 1920, obtained a doctorate in medicine in 1936, all at the Karolinska Institute. Worked as an assistant physician at the pediatric hospital Samariten from 1927 to 1928, as a junior physician at the Värmland County sanatorium from 1928 to 1930, as a temporary assistant at the Stockholm health authority's bacteriological laboratory from 1930, as a deputy and junior physician at the Serafimlasarettet medical outpatient clinic from 1930 to 1931, as a junior physician at Söderby Hospital from 1931 to 1934, and at S:t Eriks Hospital medical ward from 1934 to 1938. Temporary district physician at the Blekinge County sanatorium in Fur from 1939, and appointed district physician there since 1944. Completed study trips abroad in 1923, 1929, 1931, 1932, and 1936. Has written about 20 scientific papers and essays in internal medicine and tuberculosis.
